structure:Code.common:Description: To be used as default value if no value is provided or when no special coded qualification is assumed. Usually, it can be assumed that the source agency assigns sufficient confidence to the provided observation and/or the value is not expected to be drama

structure:Code.common:Name: Time series break
structure:Code.common:Description: Observations are characterised as such when different content exists or a different methodology has been applied to this observation as compared with the preceding one (the one given for the previous period).

structure:Code.common:Name: Definition differs
structure:Code.common:Description: Used to indicate slight deviations from the established methodology (footnote-type information); these divergences do not imply a break in time series.

structure:Code.common:Name: Estimated value
structure:Code.common:Description: Observation obtained through an estimation methodology (e.g. to produce back-casts) or based on the use of a limited amount of data or ad hoc sampling and through additional calculations (e.g. to produce a value at an early stage of the production stage while not all data are available). It may also be used in case of experimental data (e.g. in the context of a pilot ahead of a full scale production process) or in case of data of (anticipated/assessed) low quality. If needed, additional information can be provided through free text using the COMMENT_OBS attribute at the observation level or at a higher level .

structure:Code.common:Name: Forecast value
structure:Code.common:Description: Value deemed to assess the magnitude which a quantity will assume at some future point of time (as distinct from "estimated value" which attempts to assess the magnitude of an already existent quantity).

structure:Code.common:Name: Experimental value
structure:Code.common:Description: Data collected on the basis of definitions or (alternative) collection methods under development. Data not of guaranteed quality as normally expected from provider.

structure:Code.common:Name: Missing value; holiday or weekend
structure:Code.common:Description: Used in some daily data flows.

structure:Code.common:Name: Imputed value (CCSA definition)
structure:Code.common:Description: Observation imputed by international organisations to replace or fill gaps in national data series, in line with the recommendations of the United Nations Committee for the Coordination of Statistical Activities (CCSA).

structure:Code.common:Name: Derogation
structure:Code.common:Description: Clause in an agreement (e.g. legal act, gentlemen’s agreement) stating that some provisions in the agreement are not to be implemented by designated parties; these derogations may affect the observation or cause a missing value. In general, derogations are limited in time.

structure:Code.common:Name: Data included in another category
structure:Code.common:Description: This code is used when data for a given category are missing and are included in another category, sub-total or total. Generally where code “K” is used there should be a corresponding code "W - Includes data from another category" assigned to the over-covered category. Implementers and data reporters should use the COMMENT_OBS observation-level attribute to specify under which category the data are included.

structure:Code.common:Name: Missing value; data exist but were not collected
structure:Code.common:Description: Used, for example, when some data are not reported/disseminated because they are below a certain threshold.

structure:Code.common:Name: Missing value; data cannot exist
structure:Code.common:Description: Used to denote empty cells resulting from the impossibility to collect a statistical value (e.g. a particular education level or type of institution may be not applicable to a given country's education system).

structure:Code.common:Name: Not significant
structure:Code.common:Description: Used to indicate a value which is not a "real" zero (e.g. a result of 0.0004 rounded to zero).

structure:Code.common:Name: Missing value
structure:Code.common:Description: This code is to be used when no breakdown is made between the reasons why data are missing. Data can be missing due to many reasons: data cannot exist, data exist but are not collected (e.g. because they are below a certain threshold or subject to a derogation clause), data are unreliable, etc.

structure:Code.common:Name: Provisional value
structure:Code.common:Description: An observation is characterised as "provisional" when the source agency – while it bases its calculations on its standard production methodology – considers that the data, almost certainly, are expected to be revised.

structure:Code.common:Name: Missing value; suppressed
structure:Code.common:Description: Used, for example, when data are suppressed due to statistical confidentiality considerations.

structure:Code.common:Name: Revised value
structure:Code.common:Description: An observation is marked as revised when previously transmitted data are changed to inform the users that there has been a change. An additional comment (e.g. through the COMMENT_OBS attribute) may provide information on the change. To be used in Price statistics.

structure:Code.common:Name: Strike and other special events
structure:Code.common:Description: Special circumstances (e.g. strike) affecting the observation or causing a missing value.

structure:Code.common:Name: Low reliability
structure:Code.common:Description: This indicates existing observations, but for which the user should also be aware of the low quality assigned.

structure:Code.common:Name: Unvalidated value
structure:Code.common:Description: Observation as received from the respondent without further evaluation of data quality.

structure:Codelist.common:Name: Frequency
structure:Codelist.common:Description: This code list provides a set of values indicating the "frequency" of the data (e.g. weekly, monthly, quarterly). The concept “frequency” may refer to various stages in the production process, e.g. data collection or data dissemination. For example, a time series could be disseminated at annual frequency but the underlying data are compiled monthly. The code list is applicable for all different uses of "frequency". This code list was formally adopted on 4 December 2013. More information about and supporting material for this code list and SDMX code lists in general (e.g. list of generic codes for expressing general concepts like "Total", "Unknown", etc.; syntaxes for the creation of further codes; general guidelines for the creation of SDMX code lists) can be found at this address: https://sdmx.org/?page_id=4345.

structure:Code.common:Name: Annual
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every year.

structure:Code.common:Name: Half-yearly, semester
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every semester.

structure:Code.common:Name: Quarterly
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every quarter.

structure:Code.common:Name: Monthly
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every month.

structure:Code.common:Name: Weekly
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every week.

structure:Code.common:Name: Daily
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every day.

structure:Code.common:Name: Hourly
structure:Code.common:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every hour.

structure:Code.common:Name: Daily – businessweek
structure:Code.common:Description: Similar to "daily", however there are no observations for Saturdays and Sundays (so, neither "missing values" nor "numeric values" should be provided for Saturday and Sunday). This treatment ("business") is one way to deal with such cases, but it is not the only option. Such a time series could alternatively be considered daily ("D"), thus, with missing values in the weekend.

structure:Code.common:Name: Minutely
structure:Code.common:Description: While N denotes "minutely", usually, there may be no observations every minute (for several series the frequency is usually "irregular" within a day/days). And though observations may be sparse (not collected or disseminated every minute), missing values do not need to be given for the minutes when no observations exist: in any case the time stamp determines when an observation is observed.

structure:Codelist.common:Name: Time Format
structure:Codelist.common:Description: This code list provides coded information (based on the ISO 8601 standard) indicating the type of time references used in the data. It was released in 2009. More information about this code list and SDMX code lists in general (e.g. list of generic codes for expressing general concepts like "Total", "Unknown", etc.; syntaxes for the creation of further codes; general guidelines for the creation of SDMX code lists) can be found at this address: https://sdmx.org/?page_id=4345.
